Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 08:31AM kittylee wrote: Tarry, I don't know yet.  Today's treatment is 23 of 33.  Next week would start the "doubling" up but my trip has now been cancelled for other reasons so I'll be doing the normal schedule now.   At this stage, I am feeling fine.  Some reddening of the skin,  occasional itchiness and a daily 1/2 hour nap is pretty much all that's going on.  I don't know if what "we" had planned was officially considered accelerated whole breast radiation but I suppose it was, in theory.
Posts.Title: Simulation ct tarry kittylee

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2011 06:23PM kittylee wrote: I was faced with a similiar situation.  My normal rads schedule was to encroach on a long scheduled Asia trip.  When I explained the conflict, my rad onc offered to cut out the last week  and combine with the "next to last" week, doing the rads twice daily.  He explained they would have to be 6 hours apart.  I thought that was very accommodating.  Who knew?
Posts.Title: Simulation ct tarry kittylee
